Interface ec.ez.collect.Mapping

public interface Mapping
A Mapping is a finite single-valued mapping of keys to values. Equivalently, it can be considered a finite set of pairs, where each is a pair of a key and a value, and no two pairs have the same key. The notion of equality used is currently that defined by Object.equals() and Object.hashCode(), and the correct functioning of Mappings depends on keys implementing these methods correctly. XXX The notion of equality that will be used is whatever is the standard EZ equality.

asEnumeration()
Enumerates each value, once for every time it's mapped to.
associations()
containsKey(Object)
Is there a mapping for 'key'?
get(Object)
What value does 'key' map to?
keys()
Enumerates all the keys
occlude(Mapping)
Returns a Tuple of two Mappings that represent the result of occluding 'under' by this Mapping.
size()
How many keys are mapped from? Equivalently, how many pairs are in the set?
with(Object, Object)
Returns a Mapping just like this one, except that 'key' maps to 'newValue'.
without(Object)
Returns a Mapping just like this one, except that there is no mapping for 'key'.

size 
 public abstract int size()
How many keys are mapped from? Equivalently, how many pairs are in the set?

containsKey 
 public abstract boolean containsKey(Object key)
Is there a mapping for 'key'?

get 
 public abstract Object get(Object key) throws NotFoundException
What value does 'key' map to?

with 
 public abstract Mapping with(Object key,
                              Object newValue)
Returns a Mapping just like this one, except that 'key' maps to 'newValue'.

without 
 public abstract Mapping without(Object key)
Returns a Mapping just like this one, except that there is no mapping for 'key'.

keys 
 public abstract Enumeration keys()
Enumerates all the keys

asEnumeration 
 public abstract Enumeration asEnumeration()
Enumerates each value, once for every time it's mapped to. When a Mapping is coerced to an Enumeration (as in an EZ 'for' expression), this is the Enumeration used.

associations 
 public abstract AssociationEnumeration associations()
occlude 
 public abstract Tuple occlude(Mapping under)
Returns a Tuple of two Mappings that represent the result of occluding 'under' by this Mapping. The result[0] Mapping contains all the pairs of this Mapping, and additionally contains the pairs from 'under' whose keys do not conflict. The result[1] Mapping contains exactly those pairs from 'under' whose keys do conflict with a key of this Mapping.

Among other pleasant consequences, the domain of result[0] is the union of the original domains, and the domain of result[1] is the intersection of the original domains.
